page.title: 16SALE OF FARMS
page.content: When farmers get into financial difficulties they may have to sell their farm. Some farms can be sold as a whole but some are too large or too expensive (perhaps 250000 pounds) to be sold to one buyer and are therefore subdivided. In the process of subdividing the farm is split into field units and sold to individual buyers. An existing farm may perhaps double in size if the owner buys several field units from neighbouring farms. Farmhouses and oasthouses are often sold separately One farm was being sold while we were doing the Domesday Project. The farmhouse was sold to a London doctor. Another farm is up for sale including an oasthouse suitable for conversion. The farm consists of 101 acres and is up for sale in 3 lots. The farms are usually sold by auction.
